doc.field: Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Communist Party of the United States of America Records
Series II: State and District Records
Series II: State and District Records

The districts of the Communist Party, USA are administrative bodies at the regional level. Established by the Central Committee, they can cover one state, part of a state, or more than one state. Each district is made up of local clubs which form the most basic unit of the Party. Clubs are based on place of work (shop club) or on residence (neighborhood club). Officers of a district and/or a club may include a chairperson, finance secretary, educational director, labor secretary, press director, literature director, and recording secretary; multiple functions may be performed by one person. The records in this series provide a valuable illustration of how Party theory, policy, and initiatives are put into practice by membership across the country. These records include district correspondence, educational materials, essays, reports, notes, and audio recordings that reflect political discussions and policy across regional party offices. Audio recordings include state and regional conferences, committee meetings, and conventions.
